projects.title: HBCBS
projects.subTitle: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield
projects.projDescription:
Hired as an Art Director by GraficaGroup. My main account was Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey and tasked to re-design the site. I worked mostly on the interface design and the standardization of the different graphic elements that went on to the new site.
Built the Sections Control Panel in Flash, it sits right in the middle of all the main sections landing pages. It controls most of the major navigations of the site. The panel consists of 4 sections and each have 3 drop down columns that have multiple links throughout the site. To make it easier to maintain I had the Flash swf calls an XML file that gets the updates without having to touch the Flash file itself.
Designed and built interactive annual reports and numerous banners for the site.

projects.title: StaxGallery
projects.subTitle: Flash: Stax Gallery
projects.projDescription: Picture gallery built in Flash using ActionScript3. A gallery template that fed from an XML file. All media content are entered in the xml file. Themes and fonts are also provided. To access the control panel, put the cursor at the bottom of the page. Images automatically advances at set time, left and right arrows are provided to manually see the next or previous image, you can also use the right and left arrow keys in the keyboard. Unfinished personal project.

images.imgDescription: Me standing in front of my painting.

projects.title: PlayPen
projects.subTitle: Handbuild Crib
projects.projDescription: Adobe Animate application was an attempt to regain the animation market on the html world. It was closely modeled from Flash application but after couple of years in the market only a few uses it's potential. This site is a prototype done in Animate. An experiment on parallax scrolling featuring a playpen I built for my son. My github repo for this project.

projects.title: Akon
projects.subTitle: Konvict Clothing
projects.projDescription: Built this interactive animated intro for Akon's Konvict eStore. Done in Flash using ActionScript3. Click on the image description to open the link in a separate window.
